metadata.label: CLIMATE-RELATED PHYSICAL RISKS
metadata.definition: Climate-related physical risks refer to event-driven and long-term shifts in climatic patterns, encompassing acute risks from weather events like storms, floods, drought, and heatwaves, as well as chronic risks from changes in precipitation, temperature, sea level rise, water scarcity, biodiversity loss, and soil productivity changes.
